page.title: 13APLEY ESTATE NR. KEMBERTON
page.content: The stock includes an annual turn over of 800-900 beef cattle which are sold direct to an abattoir in Albrighton. There are 134 sows whose piglets are kept until they are weaners when they are sold to other farms for fattening. There are 120 pedigree rams sold for breeding to other farms and there are some commercial sheep. 3,000 partridges are kept for a syndicate shoot. The estate is farmed using a traditional crop rotation of 1 year and 3 year cycles which reduces the need for large quantities of artificial fertilizer. A variety of machinery is used enabling only 16 full time labourers to be employed who all live on the estate. Casual labour is employed at peak times.
